questions.question_text: Which type of electrical current flows in both directions?

options.A: One terminal is always negative, the other always positive.  Direction of current flow is constant, reverses only if terminal connections are reversed = Direct current
options.B: As it rotates, a voltage appearing at the end of the coil is transferred to an external circuit by slip rings and brushes = AC Generator
options.C: Number of current cycles per second: = Frequency/hertz
options.D: Used extensively in electronic devices, small appliances, and automobile electrical systems; current flow is always in the same direction = Direct current
